ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: But no! It is a Raging Blaze
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: But never. It is pure white flame
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: By no means! It will be the fierce flame
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: By no means! For the raging flames of the fire
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Never! That is indeed a blazing fire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: By no means! Verily, it will be the fire of Hell,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: By no means! Surely it is a flaming fire
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Nay, verily it is a furnace
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: But nay! for lo! it is the fire of hell
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: But no! There is a raging blaze
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: By no means! Verily it is a Flame.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Never! Indeed, it is a blazing fire,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: By no means! for it would be the Fire of Hell!-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: By no means! Verily, it will be the Fire of Hell!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: No, in truth, it is a Furnace!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: By no means! It is a Raging Fire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: No! Indeed, it is the Flame [of Hell],
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [70:15] Nay! — a refutation of his wish. Lo! [for him] it, namely, the Fire, will be the Churning Fire (lazā) — a name for Hell, [so called] because it churns its flames [tatalazzā] against the disbelievers,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (But nay!) truly this will not deliver him from the punishment-this is an answer to him-(for lo! it is the fire of hell
